text: the modern face of the Islamic Republic
of Iran accountant by day trailblazer in
the afternoon 26 year old Vanessa ferry
started riding a bike in secret as a
teenager she's part of a generation
confronting tradition and wants to be a
world champion there are just a few
obstacles in the way
by a shadow - you don't call me sport in
Iran is totally a man's domain
they say it's not appropriate for women
I want to wipe these thoughts out of
their minds and when sanctions are
lifted we'll be able to afford to buy
spare parts this is a country of
contrasts and paradox from the modern to
the conservative Friday prayer is a to
her own University the supreme leader
sets the tone in this crowd
not reformers like president Hassan
rouhani it's here that the spirit of the
revolution is kept alive in Masan
Mahmoud II a conservative cleric tells
me the message of the revolution still
radiates beyond the borders of Iran from
Lebanon to Iraq Iran has a role to play
Ron's enmity with the West has defined
its image since 1979 and negotiating
with America is done with much
apprehension by hardliners with the
United States we surely can have
economic relation trade and exchanges
but I don't believe that we can come to
a political relation
but doing business with the world does
require better relations everyone's felt
the pain of isolation even the powerful
military if sanctions are lifted Iran
will be the largest economy to reenter
the global marketplace since the breakup
of the Soviet Union Iran is a very young
country with high unemployment and high
expectations so to stave off potential
unrest the leadership here has taken a
gamble to offer hope and the prospect of
economic prosperity in exchange for
stability even at the cinema Iranians
are pushing the boundaries of what is
acceptable in a theocracy the modern and
conservative classes in this country
will have to find a way to bridge their
competing visions for Iran's future
Kim hottas BBC news Tehran
